newsitem.title: ITALY: ITALY ASKS PHILIPS TO RETHINK PLANT CLOSURE.
newsitem.headline: ITALY ASKS PHILIPS TO RETHINK PLANT CLOSURE.

text.p: Italy on Monday said it had asked Dutch group Philips Electronics NV to rethink its planned closure of a video and television manufacturing plant at Monza, north of Milan.

The Industry Ministry said in a statement that in a meeting with officials of Philips Italia and trades union leaders it had requested Philips to present alternatives to closure and to delay the plan so that ways of safeguarding jobs could be found.
Philips said in November it was restructuring television operations in Belgium, France and Italy as part of a previously announced restructuring of its Sound and Vision unit.
It said jobs at the three sites would fall by 50 percent to around 1,400. The Monza plant, which employs some 1,000, was due to close in mid-1997.
The Ministry statement that Italy would be contacting the Dutch government over the company's decision to close the Italian plant.
